Comments_List: I learned quite a lot about the US Federal Reserve, other central banks and the how and why they work.
I learned a lot about how central banking works across the world. Also how to write economic papers.

The course had a lot of guest speakers that were very interesting and fit really well into the other lecturers by Professor English. 

We were given a problem set at the very end of the course, but it might have been helpful to get smaller ones more directly after covering the topics on the problem set.

Bill English is a prestigious figure in the field and knew how to convey his industry experience in an academic setting, to students. The flow of the course was great, as was bringing in guest lecturers.
I really enjoyed all the material and Professor English. Also the guest lecturers were great and the lunches were fun.

Absolutely. Take for Bill English's lessons! You learn a lot about central banks through the lectures and through the papers you are asked to write during the semester. Good way to cap off the economics major.
Yes! Fun class, not too much work, great professor.
